title: Head of Design, Consumer Products
content:
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
You will:

Manage a business-critical team (one of the company's top priorities)
Manage a team of designers working on Stripe’s core product experiences and solving some of the most complex design problems around today
Partner closely with Design Operations to manage resourcing of projects
Collaborate with Design and Stripe leadership to determine design direction
Inspire, motivate, and lead designers and managers across experience levels to do the best work of their career
Work closely with our Product Management, Product Engineering, Comms, Marketing, and senior leadership to deliver stunning and effective work

You may be fit for this role if you:

You’ve managed a team of product designers, as well as managers before
You have experience methodically developing designers’ skills and careers
You excel at motivating and inspiring people to do their best work
You have experience recruiting and building product design teams
You are relentlessly customer-focused
You have 4+ years of people management experience
You excel at both written and spoken communication
Your best work is done in a highly collaborative way
You can find a meaningful balance between optimizing for speed, quality, and doing risky, but interesting work

You should include these in your application:

A link to your online portfolio
Your CV or LinkedIn profile
A few words about why Stripe is interesting to you

questions.description:
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

Representation is important. At Stripe, we hold ourselves to a high standard for equitable and inclusive hiring practices. Anyone who wants to work with us will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, gender identity, or sexual orientation. 

The next four sections will ask you to self-identify your gender, race/ethnicity, veteran & disability status. Your responses will be reported in aggregate only. Please be assured that your responses (or choosing not to identify) will have zero impact on your candidacy; this information is maintained confidentially and always stored separately from your application. 

Self-identification is voluntary. Please acknowledge this in the drop down below.

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
